intro: Argyranthemum maderense, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower. Argyranthemum maderense is relatively drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soil.
